1: A Psalm of David. The earth is the LORD's, and all that therein is: the compass of the world, and all that dwell therein.
2: For he hath founded it upon the seas, and builded it upon the floods.
3: Who shall go up in to the hill of the LORD? Or, who shall remain in his holy place?
4: Even he that hath innocent hands, and a clean heart: which lifteth not up his mind unto vanity, and swear not to deceive.
5: He shall receive the blessing from the LORD, and mercy from God his saviour.
6: This is the generation of them that seek him, of them that seek thy face, O Jacob. Selah;
7: Open your gates (O ye princes) let the everlasting doors be open, that the King of glory may come in.
8: Who is this King of glory? It is the LORD strong and mighty, even the LORD mighty in battle.
9: Open your gates (O ye princes) let the everlasting doors be open, that the King of glory may come in.
10: Who is this King of glory? It is the LORD of Hosts, he is the King of glory. Selah.
